intro: Anoniodes rufa, commonly known as the red-leaved anoniodes, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive reddish foliage, which becomes more pronounced in cooler temperatures. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Anoniodes rufa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking leaf color and compact growth habit.
